channel.title: 1.0.18 Patch Notes
channel.description:
## Butler: * Nightshade Wine will now kill the King the same day he is poisoned, unless healed. Can now be used before Day 4.
## King: * Can now be voted up before Day 4. * If the starting Good King is executed, then the court will be unable to accuse anyone of treason for a day. * Order Execution - Now only bypasses death immunity, and can be used before Day 4.
## Mastermind & Cult Leader:
* After failing to convert someone two times in a row, if the next conversion fails, it will instead target a random convertable player.
## Sheriff: * No longer unique or unconvertable. * Surveillance has been removed.
## Physician: * <s>Death Knights will now know who reanimated them.</s>

item.title: 1.0.18 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

And how many times do I have to tell you that the abilities will still become useless if the class dies, especially if the class they rely on is unique and dies N1.

Which is why the Ability’s are always both: Not even secondary Ability’s and Designed to be most useful early on.

RHCube:

Why wasn’t it needed?

Because of the higher chance of good King plus the punishment for killing one.

RHCube:

My main issue with this is that a higher chance for a good king + a punishment for executing a good king gives the good king a bit too much of an advantage over the other kings.

I’ve been over this. These buffs help all 3 Kings. Think of it this way, if a good king is executed how does that help BD? The answer is that it doesn’t. If it did then we would always go for fool’s. That means that the punishment is only useful for deterring the BD from executing the king. Same thing for increasing the odds of being BD. The idea is for the king to be more trustworthy and a bad target for a policy execute. This benefit however helps all kings too. An evil king can use that deturent for as long as he is still alive. If he dies then it failed anyways and that’s the game being played properly.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.0.18 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

How many times do we need to tell you that ability’s CAN effect 1 class so long as that class is always present! ESPECIALLY with the king.

And how many times do I have to tell you that the abilities will still become useless if the class dies, especially if the class they rely on is unique and dies N1. I know that this doesn’t apply to the king since there is almost always one present, but it would still make butler a better alternative to drunk.

NuclearBurrito:

It wasn’t needed anymore so it was removed.

Why wasn’t it needed?

NuclearBurrito:

Putting it on an evil king however would simply punish correct play which is never a good idea. Same with neutral king because he can side with evils.

Then the higher chance for a good king should be removed. My main issue with this is that a higher chance for a good king + a punishment for executing a good king gives the good king a bit too much of an advantage over the other kings. All kings should be equal in power, one shouldn’t be more powerful than the other.

NuclearBurrito:

Because it should not be able to bypass healing. Why do you say it should?

Healing shouldn’t be able to prevent everything. It’s a bit OP if it can stop almost any attack, and it would make sense that the king bypasses it since the king is supposed to be powerful.

NuclearBurrito:

And it definitely should not bypass visit prevention.

It already does, king’s visits do not count as visiting.
